title: Tuza's Conjecture for Threshold Graphs
main_result: Tuza holds for threshold graphs (split + cograph)

lemmas.name: tuza_threshold
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_threshold (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isThresholdGraph G) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G
implications: Any counterexample is NOT a threshold graph

key_insight: Threshold graphs are well-structured (split + cograph). Tuza holds for them.
implications_for_nu4: Counterexample is NOT a threshold graph
But threshold is very restrictive class
notes: Split graphs still open, but this special case is solved
